incidents.name: Automated Alert: No Customer Impact

incident_updates.body: We have fully investigated the Console Sub-accounts Navigation issue triggered by our automated alert, and it was determined that there is no noticeable customer impact. The incident was already resolved. If customers are unable to see the data, we suggest logging out/in again and clearing browser cookies. All systems are operational.

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with Console Sub-accounts Navigation. This issue was reported at https://status.twilio.com/incidents/tns3v8mqp88l, but since the post was resolved, we'll continue to provide updates in this current post to continue investigating customer reports. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Possible Connectivity Issue on Super SIM

incident_updates.body: The connectivity issues on Super SIM has been resolved and Super Sim is operating normally at this time.
Super SIM is now operating normally. We are continuing to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.
Super SIM is now operating normally. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

We have identified some unusual patterns in traffic from our carrier partner that is preferred in a number of countries around the world, including the United States, that could indicate some devices are having trouble connecting. We have been unable to reproduce any connection issues via our own tests and we have thus far received limits reports of issues. As such, we have opted to not block any carrier partner and network combinations as this could result to wide spread connectivity issues for other customers not impacted around the world. However, if you are currently severely impacted by connectivity issues, you can request our support team block connections on the impacted connectivity partner to see if switching to other IMSIs can improve your connectivity.

In the United States, it appears that the issue may be more likely on T-Mobile; however, that the more noticeable decline in connections on T-Mobile may be coincidental as we are still investigating the matter with our carrier partner.If you have a Network Access Profile with only T-Mobile enabled, your devices may be able to reconnect after enabling AT&T and/or Verizon. For connectivity issues in the US, we suggest first adjusting networks allowed by your Network Access Profile before we block carrier partners to force your SIMs to fallback to other IMSIs on your Super SIMs.

We have identified some unusual patterns in traffic from our carrier partner that is preferred in a number of countries around the world, including the United States, that could indicate some devices are having trouble connecting. We have been unable to reproduce any connection issues via our own tests and we have thus far received limits reports of issues. As such, we have opted to not block any carrier partner and network combinations as this could result to wide spread connectivity issues for other customers not impacted around the world. However, if you are currently severely impacted by connectivity issues, you can request our support team block connections on the impacted connectivity partner to see if switching to other IMSIs can improve your connectivity.

In the United States, it appears that the issue may be more likely on T-Mobile; however, that the more noticeable decline in connections on T-Mobile may be coincidental as we are still investigating the matter with our carrier partner.If you have a Network Access Profile with only T-Mobile enabled, your devices may be able to reconnect after enabling AT&T and/or Verizon. For connectivity issues in the US, we suggest first adjusting networks allowed by your Network Access Profile before we block carrier partners to force your SIMs to fallback to other IMSIs on your Super SIMs.

Our engineering team is investigating reports of connectivity issues on Super SIM. If you are experiencing a disruption to connectivity, please contact customer support with impacted ICCIDs and countries. We will provide an update within 4 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Conversations API Issues

incident_updates.body: Twilio's conversations API was degraded for 4 minutes between 09:14 and 09:17 Pacific Time on 09/21/2023. During this period of time, customers may have experienced HTTP 500 responses on message creation after a delay of 20 seconds. The issue has now been resolved.
